code-table.notes: See also http://www.loc.gov/standards/codelists/languages.xml, http://www.loc.gov/marc/languages/language_code.html. The following classifiers have been applied: common, transliteration, Latin/not Latin. The classifier common has been applied subjectively. The classifier transliteration has been applied by noting all languages in ALA-LC Romanization Tables at http://www.loc.gov/catdir/cpso/roman.html, minus Lepcha, Limbu, Moplah and Non-Slavic Languages (in Cyrillic Script). On the basis of http://www.omniglot.com/writing/languages.htm, it has been noted which languages use Latin script. If central pages of www.omniglot.com have not been used for a notation, type="added" has been attributed. With languages where both a script based on Latin and a script not based on Latin (mostly Cyrillic) is used, the notation gives "non Latin". The modern form of the languages is intended, unless the language name indicated otherwise. The order or family name and given name is noted in
